intro: Faramea eurycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited faramea, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by bright red, fleshy berries. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and have a glossy surface. Faramea eurycarpa is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
